critique: The executive order seems to be a routine administrative matter. It doesn't appear to be designed to evoke strong emotions. The order is about directing official communications to specific departments. Therefore, the scores for all emotions should be relatively low. I will set joy, sadness, anger, fear, disgust, and surprise all to 1 initially. After further consideration, I don't think any emotion is particularly intended, so I will revise all scores to 1.
